definitions.definition: a person who writes articles for a magazine, book or website, or who talks on a radio or television programme or at a meeting

examples.text: a regular contributor to this magazine
I am a contributor to several blogs.
She was a long-time contributor to Time Magazine.
The core of regular contributors is essential to the magazine.
She continues to be a regular contributor to the journal.

definitions.definition: a person or thing that provides money or goods to help pay for or support something

examples.text: Older people are important contributors to the economy.
the largest net contributor to EU funds
Politicians are often suspected of trying to appease campaign contributors from the oil industry.

definitions.definition: something that helps to cause something

examples.text: Sulphur dioxide is a pollutant and a major contributor to acid rain.

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from Anglo-Norman French contributour, from Latin contribut- ‘added’, from the verb contribuere, from con- ‘with’ + tribuere ‘bestow’.
